description: The destructive effects of climate change are straining natural and human communities all over the world. Yet, as policymakers search for effective policy responses, they face a fundamental political problem Every policy option lessens the costs of climate change for some while increasing the costs for others. As a result, addressing climate change provokes distributional conflicts between winners and losers, making it difficult to reach a consensus about how to adapt to the worldâ€™s new reality. This course examines the political conditions under which governments worldwide overcome these problems and find ways to cope with the effects of climate change.
title: The Politics of Adapting to Climate Change
